provisioningRoleArn.documentation: The ARN of the role associated with the provisioning template. This IoT role grants permission to provision a device.

templateArn.documentation: The ARN of the fleet provisioning template.

templateBody.documentation: The JSON formatted contents of the fleet provisioning template.

templateName.documentation: The name of the fleet provisioning template.

creationDate.documentation: The date when the fleet provisioning template version was created.

isDefaultVersion.documentation: True if the fleet provisioning template version is the default version.

templateBody.documentation: The JSON formatted contents of the fleet provisioning template version.

scheduledAuditName.documentation: The name of the scheduled audit whose information you want to get.

dayOfMonth.documentation: The day of the month on which the scheduled audit takes place. Will be "1" through "31" or "LAST". If days 29-31 are specified, and the month does not have that many days, the audit takes place on the "LAST" day of the month.

dayOfWeek.documentation: The day of the week on which the scheduled audit takes place. One of "SUN", "MON", "TUE", "WED", "THU", "FRI", or "SAT".

frequency.documentation: How often the scheduled audit takes place. One of "DAILY", "WEEKLY", "BIWEEKLY", or "MONTHLY". The start time of each audit is determined by the system.

targetCheckNames.documentation: Which checks are performed during the scheduled audit. Checks must be enabled for your account. (Use DescribeAccountAuditConfiguration to see the list of all checks, including those that are enabled or use UpdateAccountAuditConfiguration to select which checks are enabled.)

securityProfileName.documentation: The name of the security profile whose information you want to get.

additionalMetricsToRetain.documentation:
A list of metrics whose data is retained (stored). By default, data is retained for any metric used in the profile's behaviors, but it is also retained for any metric specified here.

Note: This API field is deprecated. Please use DescribeSecurityProfileResponse$additionalMetricsToRetainV2 instead.

additionalMetricsToRetainV2.documentation: A list of metrics whose data is retained (stored). By default, data is retained for any metric used in the profile's behaviors, but it is also retained for any metric specified here.

alertTargets.documentation: Where the alerts are sent. (Alerts are always sent to the console.)

behaviors.documentation: Specifies the behaviors that, when violated by a device (thing), cause an alert.

creationDate.documentation: The time the security profile was created.

lastModifiedDate.documentation: The time the security profile was last modified.

securityProfileDescription.documentation: A description of the security profile (associated with the security profile when it was created or updated).

version.documentation: The version of the security profile. A new version is generated whenever the security profile is updated.

queryString.documentation: The dynamic thing group search query string.

status.documentation: The dynamic thing group status.

creationDate.documentation: The task creation date.

failureCount.documentation: The number of things that failed to be provisioned.

inputFileBucket.documentation: The S3 bucket that contains the input file.

lastModifiedDate.documentation: The date when the task was last modified.

percentageProgress.documentation: The progress of the bulk provisioning task expressed as a percentage.

roleArn.documentation: The role ARN that grants access to the input file bucket.

status.documentation: The status of the bulk thing provisioning task.

thingName.documentation: The name of the thing.

billingGroupName.documentation: The name of the billing group the thing belongs to.

thingArn.documentation: The ARN of the thing to describe.

thingId.documentation: The ID of the thing to describe.

thingName.documentation: The name of the thing.

version.documentation:
The current version of the thing record in the registry.

To avoid unintentional changes to the information in the registry, you can pass the version information in the expectedVersion parameter of the UpdateThing and DeleteThing calls.

thingTypeMetadata.documentation: The ThingTypeMetadata contains additional information about the thing type including: creation date and time, a value indicating whether the thing type is deprecated, and a date and time when it was deprecated.

thingTypeProperties.documentation: The ThingTypeProperties contains information about the thing type including description, and a list of searchable thing attribute names.

Destination.documentation: Describes the location of the updated firmware.

s3Destination.documentation: Describes the location in S3 of the updated firmware.

target.documentation: The target from which the policy will be detached.

policyName.documentation: The name of the policy to detach.

principal.documentation:
The principal.

If the principal is a certificate, specify the certificate ARN. If the principal is an Amazon Cognito identity, specify the identity ID.

securityProfileTargetArn.documentation: The ARN of the thing group from which the security profile is detached.

principal.documentation: If the principal is a certificate, this value must be ARN of the certificate. If the principal is an Amazon Cognito identity, this value must be the ID of the Amazon Cognito identity.

thingName.documentation: The name of the thing.

ruleName.documentation: The name of the rule to disable.

DomainConfigurationSummary.documentation:
The summary of a domain configuration. A domain configuration specifies custom IoT-specific information about a domain. A domain configuration can be associated with an AWS-managed domain (for example, dbc123defghijk.iot.us-west-2.amazonaws.com), a customer managed domain, or a default endpoint.

  • Data

  • Jobs

  • CredentialProvider

The domain configuration feature is in public preview and is subject to change.

domainConfigurationName.documentation: The name of the domain configuration. This value must be unique to a region.

serviceType.documentation: The type of service delivered by the endpoint.

DynamoDBAction.documentation:
Describes an action to write to a DynamoDB table.

The tableName, hashKeyField, and rangeKeyField values must match the values used when you created the table.

The hashKeyValue and rangeKeyvalue fields use a substitution template syntax. These templates provide data at runtime. The syntax is as follows: ${sql-expression}.

You can specify any valid expression in a WHERE or SELECT clause, including JSON properties, comparisons, calculations, and functions. For example, the following field uses the third level of the topic:

"hashKeyValue": "${topic(3)}"

The following field uses the timestamp:

"rangeKeyValue": "${timestamp()}"

hashKeyType.documentation: The hash key type. Valid values are "STRING" or "NUMBER"

operation.documentation: The type of operation to be performed. This follows the substitution template, so it can be ${operation}, but the substitution must result in one of the following: INSERT, UPDATE, or DELETE.

payloadField.documentation: The action payload. This name can be customized.

rangeKeyType.documentation: The range key type. Valid values are "STRING" or "NUMBER"

roleArn.documentation: The ARN of the IAM role that grants access to the DynamoDB table.

DynamoDBv2Action.documentation:
Describes an action to write to a DynamoDB table.

This DynamoDB action writes each attribute in the message payload into it's own column in the DynamoDB table.

putItem.documentation:
Specifies the DynamoDB table to which the message data will be written. For example:

{ "dynamoDBv2": { "roleArn": "aws:iam:12341251:my-role" "putItem": { "tableName": "my-table" } } }

Each attribute in the message payload will be written to a separate column in the DynamoDB database.

roleArn.documentation: The ARN of the IAM role that grants access to the DynamoDB table.

EffectivePolicy.documentation: The policy that has the effect on the authorization results.

ElasticsearchAction.documentation: Describes an action that writes data to an Amazon Elasticsearch Service domain.

id.documentation: The unique identifier for the document you are storing.

index.documentation: The Elasticsearch index where you want to store your data.

roleArn.documentation: The IAM role ARN that has access to Elasticsearch.

type.documentation: The type of document you are storing.

EnableIoTLoggingParams.documentation: Parameters used when defining a mitigation action that enable AWS IoT logging.

logLevel.documentation: Specifies the types of information to be logged.

roleArnForLogging.documentation: The ARN of the IAM role used for logging.

ruleName.documentation: The name of the topic rule to enable.

ExponentialRolloutRate.documentation: Allows you to create an exponential rate of rollout for a job.

baseRatePerMinute.documentation: The minimum number of things that will be notified of a pending job, per minute at the start of job rollout. This parameter allows you to define the initial rate of rollout.

incrementFactor.documentation: The exponential factor to increase the rate of rollout for a job.

rateIncreaseCriteria.documentation:
The criteria to initiate the increase in rate of rollout for a job.

AWS IoT supports up to one digit after the decimal (for example, 1.5, but not 1.55).

Field.documentation: Describes the name and data type at a field.

s3Location.documentation: The location of the updated firmware in S3.

stream.documentation: The stream that contains the OTA update.

FirehoseAction.documentation: Describes an action that writes data to an Amazon Kinesis Firehose stream.

roleArn.documentation: The IAM role that grants access to the Amazon Kinesis Firehose stream.

separator.documentation: A character separator that will be used to separate records written to the Firehose stream. Valid values are: '\n' (newline), '\t' (tab), '\r\n' (Windows newline), ',' (comma).

indexName.documentation: The name of the index to search.

cardinality.documentation: The approximate count of unique values that match the query.

thingName.documentation: The thing name.

jobId.documentation: The unique identifier you assigned to this job when it was created.

roleArn.documentation: The ARN of the IAM role that grants access.

indexName.documentation: The name of the index to search.

percentiles.documentation: The percentile values of the aggregated fields.

creationDate.documentation: The date the policy was created.

lastModifiedDate.documentation: The date the policy was last modified.

policyDocument.documentation: The JSON document that describes the policy.

creationDate.documentation: The date the policy was created.

generationId.documentation: The generation ID of the policy version.

isDefaultVersion.documentation: Specifies whether the policy version is the default.

lastModifiedDate.documentation: The date the policy was last modified.

policyDocument.documentation: The JSON document that describes the policy.

indexName.documentation: The name of the index to search. The default value is AWS_Things.

queryString.documentation: The query used to search. You can specify "*" for the query string to get the count of all indexed things in your AWS account.

queryVersion.documentation: The version of the query used to search.

statistics.documentation: The statistics returned by the Fleet Indexing service based on the query and aggregation field.

arn.documentation: The ARN of the topic rule destination.

roleArn.documentation: The IAM role ARN AWS IoT uses to write to your CloudWatch logs.

GroupNameAndArn.documentation: The name and ARN of a group.

auth.documentation: The authentication method to use when sending data to an HTTPS endpoint.

confirmationUrl.documentation: The URL to which AWS IoT sends a confirmation message. The value of the confirmation URL must be a prefix of the endpoint URL. If you do not specify a confirmation URL AWS IoT uses the endpoint URL as the confirmation URL. If you use substitution templates in the confirmationUrl, you must create and enable topic rule destinations that match each possible value of the substitution template before traffic is allowed to your endpoint URL.

headers.documentation: The HTTP headers to send with the message data.

url.documentation: The endpoint URL. If substitution templates are used in the URL, you must also specify a confirmationUrl. If this is a new destination, a new TopicRuleDestination is created if possible.

value.documentation: The HTTP header value. Substitution templates are supported.

HttpAuthorization.documentation: The authorization method used to send messages.

sigv4.documentation: Use Sig V4 authorization. For more information, see Signature Version 4 Signing Process.

HttpContext.documentation: Specifies the HTTP context to use for the test authorizer request.

headers.documentation: The header keys and values in an HTTP authorization request.

queryString.documentation: The query string keys and values in an HTTP authorization request.

HttpUrlDestinationConfiguration.documentation: HTTP URL destination configuration used by the topic rule's HTTP action.

confirmationUrl.documentation: The URL AWS IoT uses to confirm ownership of or access to the topic rule destination URL.
The URL used to confirm the HTTP topic rule destination URL.
The URL used to confirm ownership of or access to the HTTP topic rule destination URL.

ImplicitDeny.documentation: Information that implicitly denies authorization. When policy doesn't explicitly deny or allow an action on a resource it is considered an implicit deny.

policies.documentation: Policies that don't contain a matching allow or deny statement for the specified action on the specified resource.

InvalidStateTransitionException.documentation: An attempt was made to change to an invalid state, for example by deleting a job or a job execution which is "IN_PROGRESS" without setting the force parameter.

IotAnalyticsAction.documentation: Sends message data to an AWS IoT Analytics channel.

channelArn.documentation: (deprecated) The ARN of the IoT Analytics channel to which message data will be sent.

channelName.documentation: The name of the IoT Analytics channel to which message data will be sent.

roleArn.documentation: The ARN of the role which has a policy that grants IoT Analytics permission to send message data via IoT Analytics (iotanalytics:BatchPutMessage).

IotEventsAction.documentation: Sends an input to an AWS IoT Events detector.

inputName.documentation: The name of the AWS IoT Events input.

messageId.documentation: [Optional] Use this to ensure that only one input (message) with a given messageId will be processed by an AWS IoT Events detector.

roleArn.documentation: The ARN of the role that grants AWS IoT permission to send an input to an AWS IoT Events detector. ("Action":"iotevents:BatchPutMessage").

IotSiteWiseAction.documentation: Describes an action to send data from an MQTT message that triggered the rule to AWS IoT SiteWise asset properties.

putAssetPropertyValueEntries.documentation: A list of asset property value entries.

roleArn.documentation: The ARN of the role that grants AWS IoT permission to send an asset property value to AWS IoTSiteWise. ("Action": "iotsitewise:BatchPutAssetPropertyValue"). The trust policy can restrict access to specific asset hierarchy paths.

Job.documentation: The Job object contains details about a job.

abortConfig.documentation: Configuration for criteria to abort the job.

comment.documentation: If the job was updated, describes the reason for the update.

completedAt.documentation: The time, in seconds since the epoch, when the job was completed.

createdAt.documentation: The time, in seconds since the epoch, when the job was created.

description.documentation: A short text description of the job.

forceCanceled.documentation: Will be true if the job was canceled with the optional force parameter set to true.

jobArn.documentation: An ARN identifying the job with format "arn:aws:iot:region:account:job/jobId".

jobExecutionsRolloutConfig.documentation: Allows you to create a staged rollout of a job.

jobId.documentation: The unique identifier you assigned to this job when it was created.

lastUpdatedAt.documentation: The time, in seconds since the epoch, when the job was last updated.

reasonCode.documentation: If the job was updated, provides the reason code for the update.

status.documentation: The status of the job, one of IN_PROGRESS, CANCELED, DELETION_IN_PROGRESS or COMPLETED.

targetSelection.documentation: Specifies whether the job will continue to run (CONTINUOUS), or will be complete after all those things specified as targets have completed the job (SNAPSHOT). If continuous, the job may also be run on a thing when a change is detected in a target. For example, a job will run on a device when the thing representing the device is added to a target group, even after the job was completed by all things originally in the group.

targets.documentation: A list of IoT things and thing groups to which the job should be sent.

timeoutConfig.documentation: Specifies the amount of time each device has to finish its execution of the job. A timer is started when the job execution status is set to IN_PROGRESS. If the job execution status is not set to another terminal state before the timer expires, it will be automatically set to TIMED_OUT.

JobExecution.documentation: The job execution object represents the execution of a job on a particular device.

approximateSecondsBeforeTimedOut.documentation: The estimated number of seconds that remain before the job execution status will be changed to TIMED_OUT. The timeout interval can be anywhere between 1 minute and 7 days (1 to 10080 minutes). The actual job execution timeout can occur up to 60 seconds later than the estimated duration. This value will not be included if the job execution has reached a terminal status.

executionNumber.documentation: A string (consisting of the digits "0" through "9") which identifies this particular job execution on this particular device. It can be used in commands which return or update job execution information.

forceCanceled.documentation: Will be true if the job execution was canceled with the optional force parameter set to true.

jobId.documentation: The unique identifier you assigned to the job when it was created.

lastUpdatedAt.documentation: The time, in seconds since the epoch, when the job execution was last updated.

queuedAt.documentation: The time, in seconds since the epoch, when the job execution was queued.

startedAt.documentation: The time, in seconds since the epoch, when the job execution started.

status.documentation: The status of the job execution (IN_PROGRESS, QUEUED, FAILED, SUCCEEDED, TIMED_OUT, CANCELED, or REJECTED).

statusDetails.documentation: A collection of name/value pairs that describe the status of the job execution.

thingArn.documentation: The ARN of the thing on which the job execution is running.

versionNumber.documentation: The version of the job execution. Job execution versions are incremented each time they are updated by a device.

executionNumber.documentation: A string (consisting of the digits "0" through "9") which identifies this particular job execution on this particular device. It can be used later in commands which return or update job execution information.

lastUpdatedAt.documentation: The time, in seconds since the epoch, when the job execution was last updated.

queuedAt.documentation: The time, in seconds since the epoch, when the job execution was queued.

startedAt.documentation: The time, in seconds since the epoch, when the job execution started.

status.documentation: The status of the job execution.

JobExecutionSummaryForJob.documentation: Contains a summary of information about job executions for a specific job.

jobExecutionSummary.documentation: Contains a subset of information about a job execution.

thingArn.documentation: The ARN of the thing on which the job execution is running.

JobExecutionSummaryForThing.documentation: The job execution summary for a thing.

jobExecutionSummary.documentation: Contains a subset of information about a job execution.

jobId.documentation: The unique identifier you assigned to this job when it was created.

JobExecutionsRolloutConfig.documentation: Allows you to create a staged rollout of a job.

exponentialRate.documentation: The rate of increase for a job rollout. This parameter allows you to define an exponential rate for a job rollout.

maximumPerMinute.documentation: The maximum number of things that will be notified of a pending job, per minute. This parameter allows you to create a staged rollout.

numberOfCanceledThings.documentation: The number of things that cancelled the job.

numberOfFailedThings.documentation: The number of things that failed executing the job.

numberOfInProgressThings.documentation: The number of things currently executing the job.

numberOfQueuedThings.documentation: The number of things that are awaiting execution of the job.

numberOfRejectedThings.documentation: The number of things that rejected the job.

numberOfRemovedThings.documentation: The number of things that are no longer scheduled to execute the job because they have been deleted or have been removed from the group that was a target of the job.

numberOfSucceededThings.documentation: The number of things which successfully completed the job.

numberOfTimedOutThings.documentation: The number of things whose job execution status is TIMED_OUT.

processingTargets.documentation: The target devices to which the job execution is being rolled out. This value will be null after the job execution has finished rolling out to all the target devices.

completedAt.documentation: The time, in seconds since the epoch, when the job completed.

createdAt.documentation: The time, in seconds since the epoch, when the job was created.

jobId.documentation: The unique identifier you assigned to this job when it was created.

lastUpdatedAt.documentation: The time, in seconds since the epoch, when the job was last updated.

status.documentation: The job summary status.

targetSelection.documentation: Specifies whether the job will continue to run (CONTINUOUS), or will be complete after all those things specified as targets have completed the job (SNAPSHOT). If continuous, the job may also be run on a thing when a change is detected in a target. For example, a job will run on a thing when the thing is added to a target group, even after the job was completed by all things originally in the group.

KinesisAction.documentation: Describes an action to write data to an Amazon Kinesis stream.

roleArn.documentation: The ARN of the IAM role that grants access to the Amazon Kinesis stream.

streamName.documentation: The name of the Amazon Kinesis stream.

LambdaAction.documentation: Describes an action to invoke a Lambda function.

maxResults.documentation: The maximum number of results to return at one time.

nextToken.documentation: The token for the next set of results.

securityProfileName.documentation: The name of the Device Defender security profile for which violations are listed.

thingName.documentation: The name of the thing whose active violations are listed.

nextToken.documentation: A token that can be used to retrieve the next set of results, or null if there are no additional results.

marker.documentation: The token to retrieve the next set of results.

pageSize.documentation: The maximum number of results to be returned per request.

target.documentation: The group or principal for which the policies will be listed.

nextMarker.documentation: The token to retrieve the next set of results, or ``null`` if there are no more results.

checkName.documentation: A filter to limit results to the findings for the specified audit check.

endTime.documentation: A filter to limit results to those found before the specified time. You must specify either the startTime and endTime or the taskId, but not both.

maxResults.documentation: The maximum number of results to return at one time. The default is 25.

nextToken.documentation: The token for the next set of results.

startTime.documentation: A filter to limit results to those found after the specified time. You must specify either the startTime and endTime or the taskId, but not both.

taskId.documentation: A filter to limit results to the audit with the specified ID. You must specify either the taskId or the startTime and endTime, but not both.

nextToken.documentation: A token that can be used to retrieve the next set of results, or null if there are no additional results.

actionStatus.documentation: Specify this filter to limit results to those with a specific status.

findingId.documentation: Specify this filter to limit results to those that were applied to a specific audit finding.

maxResults.documentation: The maximum number of results to return at one time. The default is 25.

nextToken.documentation: The token for the next set of results.

taskId.documentation: Specify this filter to limit results to actions for a specific audit mitigation actions task.

actionsExecutions.documentation: A set of task execution results based on the input parameters. Details include the mitigation action applied, start time, and task status.

nextToken.documentation: The token for the next set of results.

auditTaskId.documentation: Specify this filter to limit results to tasks that were applied to results for a specific audit.

endTime.documentation: Specify this filter to limit results to tasks that were completed or canceled on or before a specific date and time.

findingId.documentation: Specify this filter to limit results to tasks that were applied to a specific audit finding.

maxResults.documentation: The maximum number of results to return at one time. The default is 25.

nextToken.documentation: The token for the next set of results.

startTime.documentation: Specify this filter to limit results to tasks that began on or after a specific date and time.

taskStatus.documentation: Specify this filter to limit results to tasks that are in a specific state.

nextToken.documentation: The token for the next set of results.

tasks.documentation: The collection of audit mitigation tasks that matched the filter criteria.

maxResults.documentation: The maximum number of results to return at one time. The default is 25.

For example, for DimensionType TOPIC_FILTER, with IN operator, a message will be counted only if its topic matches one of the topic filters. With NOT_IN Operator, a message will be counted only if it doesn't match any of the topic filters. The operator is optional: if it's not provided (is null), it will be interpreted as IN.

MetricToRetain.documentation: The metric you want to retain. Dimensions are optional.

MetricValue.documentation: The value to be compared with the metric.

cidrs.documentation: If the comparisonOperator calls for a set of CIDRs, use this to specify that set to be compared with the metric.

count.documentation: If the comparisonOperator calls for a numeric value, use this to specify that numeric value to be compared with the metric.

ports.documentation: If the comparisonOperator calls for a set of ports, use this to specify that set to be compared with the metric.

MitigationAction.documentation: Describes which changes should be applied as part of a mitigation action.

actionParams.documentation: The set of parameters for this mitigation action. The parameters vary, depending on the kind of action you apply.

id.documentation: A unique identifier for the mitigation action.

name.documentation: A user-friendly name for the mitigation action.

roleArn.documentation: The IAM role ARN used to apply this mitigation action.

MitigationActionIdentifier.documentation: Information that identifies a mitigation action. This information is returned by ListMitigationActions.

actionArn.documentation: The IAM role ARN used to apply this mitigation action.

actionName.documentation: The friendly name of the mitigation action.

creationDate.documentation: The date when this mitigation action was created.

MitigationActionParams.documentation: The set of parameters for this mitigation action. You can specify only one type of parameter (in other words, you can apply only one action for each defined mitigation action).

addThingsToThingGroupParams.documentation: Parameters to define a mitigation action that moves devices associated with a certificate to one or more specified thing groups, typically for quarantine.

enableIoTLoggingParams.documentation: Parameters to define a mitigation action that enables AWS IoT logging at a specified level of detail.

publishFindingToSnsParams.documentation: Parameters to define a mitigation action that publishes findings to Amazon SNS. You can implement your own custom actions in response to the Amazon SNS messages.

replaceDefaultPolicyVersionParams.documentation: Parameters to define a mitigation action that adds a blank policy to restrict permissions.

updateCACertificateParams.documentation: Parameters to define a mitigation action that changes the state of the CA certificate to inactive.

updateDeviceCertificateParams.documentation: Parameters to define a mitigation action that changes the state of the device certificate to inactive.

clientId.documentation: The value of the clientId key in an MQTT authorization request.

password.documentation: The value of the password key in an MQTT authorization request.

username.documentation: The value of the username key in an MQTT authorization request.

codeSigning.documentation: The code signing method of the file.

awsIotJobArn.documentation: The AWS IoT job ARN associated with the OTA update.

awsIotJobId.documentation: The AWS IoT job ID associated with the OTA update.

awsJobExecutionsRolloutConfig.documentation: Configuration for the rollout of OTA updates.

awsJobPresignedUrlConfig.documentation: Configuration information for pre-signed URLs. Valid when protocols contains HTTP.

errorInfo.documentation: Error information associated with the OTA update.

lastModifiedDate.documentation: The date when the OTA update was last updated.

otaUpdateFiles.documentation: A list of files associated with the OTA update.

protocols.documentation: The protocol used to transfer the OTA update image. Valid values are [HTTP], [MQTT], [HTTP, MQTT]. When both HTTP and MQTT are specified, the target device can choose the protocol.

targetSelection.documentation: Specifies whether the OTA update will continue to run (CONTINUOUS), or will be complete after all those things specified as targets have completed the OTA update (SNAPSHOT). If continuous, the OTA update may also be run on a thing when a change is detected in a target. For example, an OTA update will run on a thing when the thing is added to a target group, even after the OTA update was completed by all things originally in the group.

creationDate.documentation: The date when the OTA update was created.

expiresInSec.documentation: How long (in seconds) pre-signed URLs are valid. Valid values are 60 - 3600, the default value is 3600 seconds. Pre-signed URLs are generated when Jobs receives an MQTT request for the job document.

assetId.documentation: The ID of the AWS IoT SiteWise asset. You must specify either a propertyAlias or both an aliasId and a propertyId. Accepts substitution templates.

entryId.documentation: Optional. A unique identifier for this entry that you can define to better track which message caused an error in case of failure. Accepts substitution templates. Defaults to a new UUID.

propertyAlias.documentation: The name of the property alias associated with your asset property. You must specify either a propertyAlias or both an aliasId and a propertyId. Accepts substitution templates.

propertyId.documentation: The ID of the asset's property. You must specify either a propertyAlias or both an aliasId and a propertyId. Accepts substitution templates.

propertyValues.documentation: A list of property values to insert that each contain timestamp, quality, and value (TQV) information.

tableName.documentation: The table where the message data will be written.

RateIncreaseCriteria.documentation: Allows you to define a criteria to initiate the increase in rate of rollout for a job.

numberOfNotifiedThings.documentation: The threshold for number of notified things that will initiate the increase in rate of rollout.

numberOfSucceededThings.documentation: The threshold for number of succeeded things that will initiate the increase in rate of rollout.

allowAutoRegistration.documentation: Allows this CA certificate to be used for auto registration of device certificates.

setAsActive.documentation: A boolean value that specifies if the CA certificate is set to active.

rejectReason.documentation: The reason the certificate transfer was rejected.

lastModifiedDate.documentation: The UNIX timestamp of when the role alias was last modified.

roleArn.documentation: The role ARN.

bucket.documentation: The S3 bucket that contains the updated firmware.

url.documentation: The URL exposed by the Salesforce IoT Cloud Input Stream. The URL is available from the Salesforce IoT Cloud platform after creation of the Input Stream.

dayOfMonth.documentation: The day of the month on which the scheduled audit is run (if the frequency is "MONTHLY"). If days 29-31 are specified, and the month does not have that many days, the audit takes place on the "LAST" day of the month.

dayOfWeek.documentation: The day of the week on which the scheduled audit is run (if the frequency is "WEEKLY" or "BIWEEKLY").

name.documentation: The name you have given to the security profile.

SecurityProfileTarget.documentation: A target to which an alert is sent when a security profile behavior is violated.

SecurityProfileTargetMapping.documentation: Information about a security profile and the target associated with it.

target.documentation: Information about the target (thing group) associated with the security profile.

serverCertificateStatusDetail.documentation: Details that explain the status of the server certificate.

disableAllLogs.documentation: If true all logs are disabled. The default is false.

The ARN of the signing role.

serviceName.documentation: The service name to use while signing with Sig V4.

certificatePathOnDevice.documentation: The location of the code-signing certificate on your device.

messageFormat.documentation: (Optional) The message format of the message to publish. Accepted values are "JSON" and "RAW". The default value of the attribute is "RAW". SNS uses this setting to determine if the payload should be parsed and relevant platform-specific bits of the payload should be extracted. To read more about SNS message formats, see https://docs.aws.amazon.com/sns/latest/dg/json-formats.html refer to their official documentation.

roleArn.documentation: The ARN of the IAM role that grants access.

SqlParseException.documentation: The Rule-SQL expression can't be parsed correctly.

queueUrl.documentation: The URL of the Amazon SQS queue.

roleArn.documentation: The ARN of the IAM role that grants access.

auditCheckToActionsMapping.documentation: For an audit check, specifies which mitigation actions to apply. Those actions must be defined in your AWS account.

clientRequestToken.documentation: Each audit mitigation task must have a unique client request token. If you try to start a new task with the same token as a task that already exists, an exception occurs. If you omit this value, a unique client request token is generated automatically.

target.documentation: Specifies the audit findings to which the mitigation actions are applied. You can apply them to a type of audit check, to all findings from an audit, or to a speecific set of findings.

taskId.documentation: A unique identifier for the task. You can use this identifier to check the status of the task or to cancel it.
The unique identifier for the audit mitigation task. This matches the taskId that you specified in the request.

targetCheckNames.documentation: Which checks are performed during the audit. The checks you specify must be enabled for your account or an exception occurs. Use DescribeAccountAuditConfiguration to see the list of all checks, including those that are enabled or UpdateAccountAuditConfiguration to select which checks are enabled.

taskId.documentation: The ID of the on-demand audit you started.

StartSigningJobParameter.documentation: Information required to start a signing job.

destination.documentation: The location to write the code-signed file.

inputFileBucket.documentation: The S3 bucket that contains the input file.

inputFileKey.documentation: The name of input file within the S3 bucket. This file contains a newline delimited JSON file. Each line contains the parameter values to provision one device (thing).

roleArn.documentation: The IAM role ARN that grants permission the input file.

StatisticalThreshold.documentation: A statistical ranking (percentile) which indicates a threshold value by which a behavior is determined to be in compliance or in violation of the behavior.

statistic.documentation: The percentile which resolves to a threshold value by which compliance with a behavior is determined. Metrics are collected over the specified period (durationSeconds) from all reporting devices in your account and statistical ranks are calculated. Then, the measurements from a device are collected over the same period. If the accumulated measurements from the device fall above or below (comparisonOperator) the value associated with the percentile specified, then the device is considered to be in compliance with the behavior, otherwise a violation occurs.

Statistics.documentation: A map of key-value pairs for all supported statistics. Currently, only count is supported.

average.documentation: The average of the aggregated field values.

count.documentation: The count of things that match the query.

stdDeviation.documentation: The standard deviation of the aggregated field values.

sum.documentation: The sum of the aggregated field values.

sumOfSquares.documentation: The sum of the squares of the aggregated field values.

variance.documentation: The variance of the aggregated field values.

StepFunctionsAction.documentation: Starts execution of a Step Functions state machine.

executionNamePrefix.documentation: (Optional) A name will be given to the state machine execution consisting of this prefix followed by a UUID. Step Functions automatically creates a unique name for each state machine execution if one is not provided.

roleArn.documentation: The ARN of the role that grants IoT permission to start execution of a state machine ("Action":"states:StartExecution").

stateMachineName.documentation: The name of the Step Functions state machine whose execution will be started.

Stream.documentation: Describes a group of files that can be streamed.

fileId.documentation: The ID of a file associated with a stream.

s3Location.documentation: The location of the file in S3.

createdAt.documentation: The date when the stream was created.

lastUpdatedAt.documentation: The date when the stream was last updated.

roleArn.documentation: An IAM role AWS IoT assumes to access your S3 files.

Tag.documentation: A set of key/value pairs that are used to manage the resource.

tags.documentation: The new or modified tags for the resource.

TaskAlreadyExistsException.documentation: This exception occurs if you attempt to start a task with the same task-id as an existing task but with a different clientRequestToken.

TaskStatistics.documentation: Statistics for the checks performed during the audit.

canceledChecks.documentation: The number of checks that did not run because the audit was canceled.

compliantChecks.documentation: The number of checks that found compliant resources.

nonCompliantChecks.documentation: The number of checks that found noncompliant resources.

totalChecks.documentation: The number of checks in this audit.

waitingForDataCollectionChecks.documentation: The number of checks waiting for data collection.

TaskStatisticsForAuditCheck.documentation: Provides summary counts of how many tasks for findings are in a particular state. This information is included in the response from DescribeAuditMitigationActionsTask.

canceledFindingsCount.documentation: The number of findings to which the mitigation action task was canceled when applied.

failedFindingsCount.documentation: The number of findings for which at least one of the actions failed when applied.

skippedFindingsCount.documentation: The number of findings skipped because of filter conditions provided in the parameters to the command.

succeededFindingsCount.documentation: The number of findings for which all mitigation actions succeeded when applied.

totalFindingsCount.documentation: The total number of findings to which a task is being applied.

authInfos.documentation: A list of authorization info objects. Simulating authorization will create a response for each authInfo object in the list.

policyNamesToAdd.documentation: When testing custom authorization, the policies specified here are treated as if they are attached to the principal being authorized.

policyNamesToSkip.documentation: When testing custom authorization, the policies specified here are treated as if they are not attached to the principal being authorized.

token.documentation: The token returned by your custom authentication service.

tokenSignature.documentation: The signature made with the token and your custom authentication service's private key.

disconnectAfterInSeconds.documentation: The number of seconds after which the connection is terminated.

isAuthenticated.documentation: True if the token is authenticated, otherwise false.

refreshAfterInSeconds.documentation: The number of seconds after which the temporary credentials are refreshed.

ThingAttribute.documentation: The properties of the thing, including thing name, thing type name, and a list of thing attributes.

attributes.documentation: A list of thing attributes which are name-value pairs.

thingName.documentation: The name of the thing.

thingTypeName.documentation: The name of the thing type, if the thing has been associated with a type.

version.documentation: The version of the thing record in the registry.

connected.documentation: True if the thing is connected to the AWS IoT service; false if it is not connected.

timestamp.documentation: The epoch time (in milliseconds) when the thing last connected or disconnected. If the thing has been disconnected for more than a few weeks, the time value might be missing.

connectivity.documentation: Indicates whether the thing is connected to the AWS IoT service.

thingName.documentation: The thing name.

customFields.documentation:
A list of thing group fields to index. This list cannot contain any managed fields. Use the GetIndexingConfiguration API to get a list of managed fields.

Contains custom field names and their data type.

managedFields.documentation: Contains fields that are indexed and whose types are already known by the Fleet Indexing service.

creationDate.documentation: The UNIX timestamp of when the thing group was created.

attributePayload.documentation: The thing group attributes in JSON format.

ThingIndexingConfiguration.documentation: The thing indexing configuration. For more information, see Managing Thing Indexing.

customFields.documentation: Contains custom field names and their data type.

managedFields.documentation: Contains fields that are indexed and whose types are already known by the Fleet Indexing service.

thingConnectivityIndexingMode.documentation:
Thing connectivity indexing mode. Valid values are:

  • STATUS – Your thing index contains connectivity status. To enable thing connectivity indexing, thingIndexMode must not be set to OFF.

  • OFF - Thing connectivity status indexing is disabled.

thingIndexingMode.documentation:
Thing indexing mode. Valid values are:

  • REGISTRY – Your thing index contains registry data only.

  • REGISTRY_AND_SHADOW - Your thing index contains registry and shadow data.

  • OFF - Thing indexing is disabled.

ThingTypeDefinition.documentation: The definition of the thing type, including thing type name and description.

thingTypeMetadata.documentation: The ThingTypeMetadata contains additional information about the thing type including: creation date and time, a value indicating whether the thing type is deprecated, and a date and time when it was deprecated.

ThingTypeMetadata.documentation: The ThingTypeMetadata contains additional information about the thing type including: creation date and time, a value indicating whether the thing type is deprecated, and a date and time when time was deprecated.

creationDate.documentation: The date and time when the thing type was created.

deprecated.documentation: Whether the thing type is deprecated. If true, no new things could be associated with this type.

deprecationDate.documentation: The date and time when the thing type was deprecated.

ThingTypeProperties.documentation: The ThingTypeProperties contains information about the thing type including: a thing type description, and a list of searchable thing attribute names.

searchableAttributes.documentation: A list of searchable thing attribute names.

TimeoutConfig.documentation: Specifies the amount of time each device has to finish its execution of the job. A timer is started when the job execution status is set to IN_PROGRESS. If the job execution status is not set to another terminal state before the timer expires, it will be automatically set to TIMED_OUT.

inProgressTimeoutInMinutes.documentation: Specifies the amount of time, in minutes, this device has to finish execution of this job. The timeout interval can be anywhere between 1 minute and 7 days (1 to 10080 minutes). The in progress timer can't be updated and will apply to all job executions for the job. Whenever a job execution remains in the IN_PROGRESS status for longer than this interval, the job execution will fail and switch to the terminal TIMED_OUT status.

TlsContext.documentation: Specifies the TLS context to use for the test authorizer request.

serverName.documentation: The value of the serverName key in a TLS authorization request.

awsIotSqlVersion.documentation: The version of the SQL rules engine to use when evaluating the rule.

createdAt.documentation: The date and time the rule was created.

errorAction.documentation: The action to perform when an error occurs.

sql.documentation: The SQL statement used to query the topic. When using a SQL query with multiple lines, be sure to escape the newline characters.

status.documentation:
The status of the topic rule destination. Valid values are:

IN_PROGRESS

A topic rule destination was created but has not been confirmed. You can set status to IN_PROGRESS by calling UpdateTopicRuleDestination. Calling UpdateTopicRuleDestination causes a new confirmation challenge to be sent to your confirmation endpoint.

ENABLED

Confirmation was completed, and traffic to this destination is allowed. You can set status to DISABLED by calling UpdateTopicRuleDestination.

DISABLED

Confirmation was completed, and traffic to this destination is not allowed. You can set status to ENABLED by calling UpdateTopicRuleDestination.

ERROR

Confirmation could not be completed, for example if the confirmation timed out. You can call GetTopicRuleDestination for details about the error. You can set status to IN_PROGRESS by calling UpdateTopicRuleDestination. Calling UpdateTopicRuleDestination causes a new confirmation challenge to be sent to your confirmation endpoint.

statusReason.documentation: Additional details or reason why the topic rule destination is in the current status.

status.documentation:
The status of the topic rule destination. Valid values are:

IN_PROGRESS

A topic rule destination was created but has not been confirmed. You can set status to IN_PROGRESS by calling UpdateTopicRuleDestination. Calling UpdateTopicRuleDestination causes a new confirmation challenge to be sent to your confirmation endpoint.

ENABLED

Confirmation was completed, and traffic to this destination is allowed. You can set status to DISABLED by calling UpdateTopicRuleDestination.

DISABLED

Confirmation was completed, and traffic to this destination is not allowed. You can set status to ENABLED by calling UpdateTopicRuleDestination.

ERROR

Confirmation could not be completed, for example if the confirmation timed out. You can call GetTopicRuleDestination for details about the error. You can set status to IN_PROGRESS by calling UpdateTopicRuleDestination. Calling UpdateTopicRuleDestination causes a new confirmation challenge to be sent to your confirmation endpoint.

statusReason.documentation: The reason the topic rule destination is in the current status.

createdAt.documentation: The date and time the rule was created.

topicPattern.documentation: The pattern for the topic names that apply.

awsIotSqlVersion.documentation: The version of the SQL rules engine to use when evaluating the rule.

errorAction.documentation: The action to take when an error occurs.

sql.documentation: The SQL statement used to query the topic. For more information, see AWS IoT SQL Reference in the AWS IoT Developer Guide.

TransferAlreadyCompletedException.documentation: You can't revert the certificate transfer because the transfer is already complete.

certificateId.documentation: The ID of the certificate. (The last part of the certificate ARN contains the certificate ID.)

TransferConflictException.documentation: You can't transfer the certificate because authorization policies are still attached.

TransferData.documentation: Data used to transfer a certificate to an AWS account.

rejectReason.documentation: The reason why the transfer was rejected.

UnauthorizedException.documentation: You are not authorized to perform this operation.

tagKeys.documentation: A list of the keys of the tags to be removed from the resource.

auditCheckConfigurations.documentation:
Specifies which audit checks are enabled and disabled for this account. Use DescribeAccountAuditConfiguration to see the list of all checks, including those that are currently enabled.

Some data collection might start immediately when certain checks are enabled. When a check is disabled, any data collected so far in relation to the check is deleted.

You cannot disable a check if it is used by any scheduled audit. You must first delete the check from the scheduled audit or delete the scheduled audit itself.

On the first call to UpdateAccountAuditConfiguration, this parameter is required and must specify at least one enabled check.

auditNotificationTargetConfigurations.documentation: Information about the targets to which audit notifications are sent.

roleArn.documentation: The ARN of the role that grants permission to AWS IoT to access information about your devices, policies, certificates and other items as required when performing an audit.

authorizerFunctionArn.documentation: The ARN of the authorizer's Lambda function.

status.documentation: The status of the update authorizer request.

tokenKeyName.documentation: The key used to extract the token from the HTTP headers.

tokenSigningPublicKeys.documentation: The public keys used to verify the token signature.

expectedVersion.documentation: The expected version of the billing group. If the version of the billing group does not match the expected version specified in the request, the UpdateBillingGroup request is rejected with a VersionConflictException.

version.documentation: The latest version of the billing group.

UpdateCACertificateParams.documentation: Parameters to define a mitigation action that changes the state of the CA certificate to inactive.

action.documentation: The action that you want to apply to the CA cerrtificate. The only supported value is DEACTIVATE.

certificateId.documentation: The CA certificate identifier.

newAutoRegistrationStatus.documentation: The new value for the auto registration status. Valid values are: "ENABLE" or "DISABLE".

newStatus.documentation:
The updated status of the CA certificate.

Note: The status value REGISTER_INACTIVE is deprecated and should not be used.

certificateId.documentation: The ID of the certificate. (The last part of the certificate ARN contains the certificate ID.)

newStatus.documentation:
The new status.

Note: Setting the status to PENDING_TRANSFER or PENDING_ACTIVATION will result in an exception being thrown. PENDING_TRANSFER and PENDING_ACTIVATION are statuses used internally by AWS IoT. They are not intended for developer use.

Note: The status value REGISTER_INACTIVE is deprecated and should not be used.

UpdateDeviceCertificateParams.documentation: Parameters to define a mitigation action that changes the state of the device certificate to inactive.

action.documentation: The action that you want to apply to the device cerrtificate. The only supported value is DEACTIVATE.

name.documentation: A unique identifier for the dimension. Choose something that describes the type and value to make it easy to remember what it does.

stringValues.documentation: Specifies the value or list of values for the dimension. For TOPIC_FILTER dimensions, this is a pattern used to match the MQTT topic (for example, "admin/#").

arn.documentation: The ARN (Amazon resource name) of the created dimension.

creationDate.documentation: The date and time, in milliseconds since epoch, when the dimension was initially created.

lastModifiedDate.documentation: The date and time, in milliseconds since epoch, when the dimension was most recently updated.

stringValues.documentation: The value or list of values used to scope the dimension. For example, for topic filters, this is the pattern used to match the MQTT topic name.

authorizerConfig.documentation: An object that specifies the authorization service for a domain.

domainConfigurationName.documentation: The name of the domain configuration to be updated.

domainConfigurationStatus.documentation: The status to which the domain configuration should be updated.

removeAuthorizerConfig.documentation: Removes the authorization configuration from a domain.

domainConfigurationArn.documentation: The ARN of the domain configuration that was updated.

domainConfigurationName.documentation: The name of the domain configuration that was updated.

expectedVersion.documentation: The expected version of the dynamic thing group to update.

indexName.documentation:
The dynamic thing group index to update.

Currently one index is supported: 'AWS_Things'.

queryString.documentation: The dynamic thing group search query string to update.

queryVersion.documentation:
The dynamic thing group query version to update.

Currently one query version is supported: "2017-09-30". If not specified, the query version defaults to this value.

thingGroupName.documentation: The name of the dynamic thing group to update.

thingGroupProperties.documentation: The dynamic thing group properties to update.

abortConfig.documentation: Allows you to create criteria to abort a job.

description.documentation: A short text description of the job.

jobExecutionsRolloutConfig.documentation: Allows you to create a staged rollout of the job.

jobId.documentation: The ID of the job to be updated.

timeoutConfig.documentation: Specifies the amount of time each device has to finish its execution of the job. The timer is started when the job execution status is set to IN_PROGRESS. If the job execution status is not set to another terminal state before the time expires, it will be automatically set to TIMED_OUT.

actionName.documentation: The friendly name for the mitigation action. You can't change the name by using UpdateMitigationAction. Instead, you must delete and re-create the mitigation action with the new name.

actionParams.documentation: Defines the type of action and the parameters for that action.

roleArn.documentation: The ARN of the IAM role that is used to apply the mitigation action.

actionArn.documentation: The ARN for the new mitigation action.

actionId.documentation: A unique identifier for the mitigation action.

defaultVersionId.documentation: The ID of the default provisioning template version.

description.documentation: The description of the fleet provisioning template.

enabled.documentation: True to enable the fleet provisioning template, otherwise false.

provisioningRoleArn.documentation: The ARN of the role associated with the provisioning template. This IoT role grants permission to provision a device.

templateName.documentation: The name of the fleet provisioning template.

credentialDurationSeconds.documentation: The number of seconds the credential will be valid.

roleArn.documentation: The role ARN.

dayOfMonth.documentation: The day of the month on which the scheduled audit takes place. Can be "1" through "31" or "LAST". This field is required if the "frequency" parameter is set to "MONTHLY". If days 29-31 are specified, and the month does not have that many days, the audit takes place on the "LAST" day of the month.

dayOfWeek.documentation: The day of the week on which the scheduled audit takes place. Can be one of "SUN", "MON", "TUE", "WED", "THU", "FRI", or "SAT". This field is required if the "frequency" parameter is set to "WEEKLY" or "BIWEEKLY".

frequency.documentation: How often the scheduled audit takes place. Can be one of "DAILY", "WEEKLY", "BIWEEKLY", or "MONTHLY". The start time of each audit is determined by the system.

scheduledAuditName.documentation: The name of the scheduled audit. (Max. 128 chars)

targetCheckNames.documentation: Which checks are performed during the scheduled audit. Checks must be enabled for your account. (Use DescribeAccountAuditConfiguration to see the list of all checks, including those that are enabled or use UpdateAccountAuditConfiguration to select which checks are enabled.)

additionalMetricsToRetain.documentation:
A list of metrics whose data is retained (stored). By default, data is retained for any metric used in the profile's behaviors, but it is also retained for any metric specified here.

Note: This API field is deprecated. Please use UpdateSecurityProfileRequest$additionalMetricsToRetainV2 instead.

additionalMetricsToRetainV2.documentation: A list of metrics whose data is retained (stored). By default, data is retained for any metric used in the profile's behaviors, but it is also retained for any metric specified here.

alertTargets.documentation: Where the alerts are sent. (Alerts are always sent to the console.)

behaviors.documentation: Specifies the behaviors that, when violated by a device (thing), cause an alert.

deleteAdditionalMetricsToRetain.documentation: If true, delete all additionalMetricsToRetain defined for this security profile. If any additionalMetricsToRetain are defined in the current invocation, an exception occurs.

deleteAlertTargets.documentation: If true, delete all alertTargets defined for this security profile. If any alertTargets are defined in the current invocation, an exception occurs.

deleteBehaviors.documentation: If true, delete all behaviors defined for this security profile. If any behaviors are defined in the current invocation, an exception occurs.

expectedVersion.documentation: The expected version of the security profile. A new version is generated whenever the security profile is updated. If you specify a value that is different from the actual version, a VersionConflictException is thrown.

securityProfileName.documentation: The name of the security profile you want to update.

additionalMetricsToRetain.documentation:
A list of metrics whose data is retained (stored). By default, data is retained for any metric used in the security profile's behaviors, but it is also retained for any metric specified here.

Note: This API field is deprecated. Please use UpdateSecurityProfileResponse$additionalMetricsToRetainV2 instead.

additionalMetricsToRetainV2.documentation: A list of metrics whose data is retained (stored). By default, data is retained for any metric used in the profile's behaviors, but it is also retained for any metric specified here.

alertTargets.documentation: Where the alerts are sent. (Alerts are always sent to the console.)

behaviors.documentation: Specifies the behaviors that, when violated by a device (thing), cause an alert.

creationDate.documentation: The time the security profile was created.

lastModifiedDate.documentation: The time the security profile was last modified.

securityProfileArn.documentation: The ARN of the security profile that was updated.

securityProfileName.documentation: The name of the security profile that was updated.

version.documentation: The updated version of the security profile.

roleArn.documentation: An IAM role that allows the IoT service principal assumes to access your S3 files.

expectedVersion.documentation: The expected version of the thing group. If this does not match the version of the thing group being updated, the update will fail.

version.documentation: The version of the updated thing group.

overrideDynamicGroups.documentation: Override dynamic thing groups with static thing groups when 10-group limit is reached. If a thing belongs to 10 thing groups, and one or more of those groups are dynamic thing groups, adding a thing to a static group removes the thing from the last dynamic group.

thingGroupsToAdd.documentation: The groups to which the thing will be added.

thingGroupsToRemove.documentation: The groups from which the thing will be removed.

thingName.documentation: The thing whose group memberships will be updated.

attributePayload.documentation:
A list of thing attributes, a JSON string containing name-value pairs. For example:

{\"attributes\":{\"name1\":\"value2\"}}

This data is used to add new attributes or update existing attributes.

expectedVersion.documentation: The expected version of the thing record in the registry. If the version of the record in the registry does not match the expected version specified in the request, the UpdateThing request is rejected with a VersionConflictException.

removeThingType.documentation: Remove a thing type association. If true, the association is removed.

thingName.documentation: The name of the thing to update.

arn.documentation: The ARN of the topic rule destination.

status.documentation:
The status of the topic rule destination. Valid values are:

IN_PROGRESS

A topic rule destination was created but has not been confirmed. You can set status to IN_PROGRESS by calling UpdateTopicRuleDestination. Calling UpdateTopicRuleDestination causes a new confirmation challenge to be sent to your confirmation endpoint.

ENABLED

Confirmation was completed, and traffic to this destination is allowed. You can set status to DISABLED by calling UpdateTopicRuleDestination.

DISABLED

Confirmation was completed, and traffic to this destination is not allowed. You can set status to ENABLED by calling UpdateTopicRuleDestination.

ERROR

Confirmation could not be completed, for example if the confirmation timed out. You can call GetTopicRuleDestination for details about the error. You can set status to IN_PROGRESS by calling UpdateTopicRuleDestination. Calling UpdateTopicRuleDestination causes a new confirmation challenge to be sent to your confirmation endpoint.

behaviors.documentation: Specifies the behaviors that, when violated by a device (thing), cause an alert.

validationErrors.documentation: The list of any errors found in the behaviors.

ValidationError.documentation: Information about an error found in a behavior specification.

errorMessage.documentation: The description of an error found in the behaviors.

VersionConflictException.documentation: An exception thrown when the version of an entity specified with the expectedVersion parameter does not match the latest version in the system.

VersionsLimitExceededException.documentation: The number of policy versions exceeds the limit.

ViolationEvent.documentation: Information about a Device Defender security profile behavior violation.

securityProfileName.documentation: The name of the security profile whose behavior was violated.

thingName.documentation: The name of the thing responsible for the violation event.
